explanation: The report is correct. The code calls strcmp(method, MHD_HTTP_METHOD_GET) and strcmp(method, MHD_HTTP_METHOD_HEAD) without first ensuring that 'method' is a non-NULL pointer to a NUL-terminated array of char. strcmp (a <string.h> function) will read bytes until a NUL is found, so if 'method' is NULL or does not point to a NUL-terminated buffer this can result in accesses beyond the bounds of the object referenced by 'method' (or a NULL dereference). That is precisely what MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 forbids unless a valid external guarantee exists. The snippet shown contains no such check or proof; therefore the reported violation stands unless the surrounding API/documentation (the caller) formally guarantees that 'method' is always non-NULL and NUL-terminated. A compliant fix is to validate method (e.g. check method != NULL) or otherwise rely on a documented, verifiable precondition.
